intro: Argomuellera perrieri, commonly known as the Perrier's argomuellera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
